edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:52): for 'width' it returns the used value unless the element is not rendered (different from not in the DOM) in which case it returns the computed value
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:53): though not quite the computed value, since all non-percentages and non-keywords are normalized to pixels, which is not an absolute unit
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:55): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554, not really, I realized it two years ago, which is why I postponed working on this

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:57): so percentages for a rendered document do not get converted to pixels
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:58): the result of all this is http://dev.w3.org/csswg/cssom/#resolved-values
